definition: (of a bird) to have become fully fledged/(fig.) (of a person) to have grown up (and become independent)/to be ready to spread one's wings

sentences.english: Tore his old wings off with a sigh.
sentences.chinese: 嘆息着他撕下自己古老的鮮血淋淋的翅膀。

sentences.english: Tie up the white plastic cloth of double claw and wing.
sentences.chinese: 束縛着雙爪和翅膀的白色膠布。

sentences.english: The bird's large wings enable it to fly.
sentences.chinese: 這鳥的大翅膀使它能飛。

sentences.english: At once she changed into a crane and opening her beautiful wings, she flew up into the sky.
sentences.chinese: 阿姿即刻變成了一隻鶴，張開漂亮的翅膀飛向天空。

sentences.english: The wings of a crow can never cover up the sun.
sentences.chinese: 烏鴉的翅膀遮不住太陽。

sentences.english: Griffins now sometimes glide rather than always flapping their wings.
sentences.chinese: 新來者現在有時滑動不願總是拍打他們的翅膀。

sentences.english: The red marks of the wings and tail's projections are the characteristics of spangle .
sentences.chinese: 黑鳳蝶的特點是紅色的花紋和翅膀後邊兒有突起。

sentences.english: The Toucan has a large yellow and black beak and blue striped wings.
sentences.chinese: 犀鳥款有一個黃色和黑色的嘴和藍色條紋的翅膀。

sentences.english: There must be a reason why Xenicibis had such strange wings.
sentences.chinese: 始祖鳥擁有如此奇怪的翅膀一定事出有因。

sentences.english: And the sound of the cherubims' wings was heard even to the outer court, as the voice of the Almighty God when he speaketh.
sentences.chinese: 基路伯翅膀的響聲聽到外院，好像全能神說話的聲音。

sentences.english: Embracing by glamorous light, the meteor is under the wings of Cupid.
sentences.chinese: 被一羣光芒所包圍的流星，是被愛神翅膀所保護的。

sentences.english: I would fly to the moon if I had wings.
sentences.chinese: 如果我長上翅膀的話，我就要飛到月球上去。

sentences.english: And all bumblebees have tiny wings, relative to their body size.
sentences.chinese: 而所有的大黃蜂都只有相對其體形而言很小的翅膀。

sentences.english: Some tropical rhododendrons on the back like wings, like the rainbow blue.
sentences.chinese: 有些熱帶杜鵑的背上翅膀上有像彩虹一樣的藍色。

sentences.english: The bird fluttered its wings in the cage.
Chiefly British A hawk of the genus Buteo , having broad wings and a broad tail.
sentences.chinese: 屬的一種鷹，有寬大的翅膀和寬尾巴。

definition: to fan/to flap/to incite/to instigate (a strike etc)
to circle in the air/to soar
to spread one's wings and soar (idiom)/to develop one's abilities freely
bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam
to soar/to wheel about in the sky
